channel.title: Hard drive no worky :(
channel.description:
My 35 day old 640gb 2.5" samsung HDD died this morning, with windows going mental saying I need to backup immediately as you'd expect... The speedfan S.M.A.R.T. test: [URL=http://img27.imageshack.us/i/3050511.png/][IMG]http://img27.imageshack.us/img27/9666/3050511.th.png[/img][/URL]
Basically the fitness has been decreasing 1% every day ever since 28th of April, and I never thought to do anything about it, besides take screenshots in increments of 2 days... until it died today.
So um, I emailed Overclockers UK today and they said they can replace it... but should I ask for a refund and get a different one? Has anyone else had bad experiences with samsung drives?
Additional info, it's a secondary internal drive for my laptop (two bays), and my primary hdd is still in perfect shape even though that one is a little over a year old. I think it's possible that continuously leaving my laptop on overnight (botting, downloading, defragging etc) has brought it's lifespan down a little, but this one only lasted a month... faulty? Oh and data loss is not a problem, I have a 1TB external HDD which constantly backs up whenever plugged in.

item.title: Hard drive no worky :(
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:9, topic:393858”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=491043.msg3594822#msg3594822 date=1304976774]

Guess I’ll just get a standard replacement and hope it was just faulty then.
Would the temperature running at 50C constantly (10C+ higher than my other hdd) do this sort of damage?

I don’t think that should matter all too much.
The temps do seem kinda high though, my drives run at 26c and 25c, but that’s probably due to the 12cm fan in front of it.

But are you running a laptop? Temperatures are generally higher for laptops…
Also I use a 19 inch zalman cooling pad with dual fans, cost me 40 quid.
[/quote]
what laptop would have a 12cm fan in front of the HDD :P[/quote]
My friend has a 12cm cooler actually, but obviously it doesn’t direct straight onto the HDD, guess that was a stupid question…

Read full topic

item.title: Hard drive no worky :(
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

I’ve got two Samsung Spinpoint F1 1tb drives, and both are still working fine after 1.5 years.
But as usual, some people have problems with their drives, others don’t, so I think arguing about it is kinda moot.

Read full topic
